text: I had an idea of working in Bombay with
the musicians which had the equivalent
of like the Bollywood musicians the film
musicians at the time and going in there
with a project whereby I'd requested the
musicians but they didn't know what we
were going to do for Styx was pretty
complex a great that we even though they
that they were incredible players to it
the technicality that that they had was
they were able to play this by
approaching their technique to it but it
kept me on my toes I think I said in the
past it was tricky well it was tricky to
go many musicians that you've never met
there's no Indian arranger there and to
be able to sort of convey what it is
that you want and illustrate it on the
guitar and and then play with them on
one number and then sort of more or less
conduct on the other
I had listened to both the music of
northern India and southern India and I
had a you know I was familiar with the
instruments like Sarang G and Chennai
and I actually requested those to be in
on that session to have these
instruments and tabla and bingum
etcetera and I I just knew that it would
work and it did work
you
